column4: i just installed jaunty and my display is just YUK - low resolution and it keeps telling me unknown LCD
it's @ 640x480px
now i wonder what to do
i am a newbie - so no i havn't yet
oh it was an old NVIDA 5200 (it's the officePC and i am tomorrow in office... so i should fix this - forcing my boss to ubuntu)
hehe
i have installed the latest driver  - i think it was 173
for this GPU
o i did @ legend2440
problem is i cant change anymore (this menu way higher > 480px) lol - it's a pain
sudo apt-get install nvidia-glx-173
ok what do you get if you run:
gksudo nvidia-settings
does it say no driver loaded
the monitor isnt important
is the monitor a crt or flatscreen?
run: gksudo gedit /etc/X11/xorg.conf
you will see Identifier     "Configured Video Device"
under that you will need to add: Driver "nvidia"
if a driver line already exists then change it to nvidia
then save the file and restart x
